value.title: DAX for Power BI - Calculate Cumulative Sum (Running Total) of Count in Power BI
value.excerpt: The cumulative total is also known as Running total and during this video, we will talk about how we can calculate a cumulative sum for request count using Power BI Dax measure in Power BI.  During this session, we will cover the following things: ‚Ä¢ Real-life example where we need Cumulative Sum 00:21

value.title: Combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX. Just a little bit of DAX! This can be useful when you want to use a single report tooltip for multiple Power BI visuals.  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI! However, sometimes, you just want this to be in DAX way, so here in this blog and video, I explained how to create

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. You need to learn how to reference columns, and tables. what operators can be used, and what are the very simple basics of writing a DAX expression. In
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/GVAzp-YICnQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX

value.title: Create a subset of the table in Power BI and add calculations using SELECTCOLUMNS DAX Function
value.excerpt: Previously I explained the AddColumns function as a function that adds one or more columns to the existing table, In this article and video, I'll explain another similar and useful function with slightly different behavior: SelectColumns, and you will learn how you can use it in Power BI and DAX. value.title: Document a Power BI file and report in a few clicks   all DAX code visualization Power Query scripts
value.excerpt: In this article and video, I‚Äôll share with you how to document everything from a Power BI file in a few clicks. The document output will have all the DAX code (measures, columns, and tables) with the expressions, the tables with the Power Query scripts, information about visualization such as how many

value.title: Dynamic Banding or Grouping in Power BI ‚Äì Using DAX Measures ‚Äì Choose the Size of Bins
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how to create dynamic bins by choosing the count of bins in a slicer in the Power BI report. In this video, I'll explain, how you can do it the other way around, which is by selecting the size of the bin, you will have bins and buckets dynamically generated. Download

value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I‚Äôll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi

value.title: Power BI Modeling Tip   Snapshot Table or DAX Measures
value.excerpt: I often get this question: ‚ÄúIs it better that I create this calculation as a snapshot table in Power Query (or T-SQL, or the data source), or write DAX measures for it?‚Äù If you ever had a scenario of creating a report of snapshots, you know what I mean. ‚ÄúShould I have a table for inventory stock on hand
